result.execSummary:
All charges against Robert Christopher Stuczynski in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Christopher Stuczynski is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Christopher Stuczynski

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski not in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State of Wisconsin no longer wants to extradite Defendant.  Deputy sheriff requesting the case closed due to subject got revoked on a different case and is going to prison. On State's Motion, Court ordered case dismissed.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Status Conference held. Defendant's pending matter calendared for Scheduling Conference on September 1, 2022 in Branch 40.  At request of State, Court adjourns matter. Court continues Order that Defendant be REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case adjourned for Status Conference, Branch ICCR.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski not in court, defendant in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has an open felony case pending before Judge Shelton, Br. 40.  The State of Minnesota has not picked up the defendant.  Case is adjourned to 8-3-22 at 8:30 am for status conference in ICCR.
  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Minnesota.  Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
